caniuse.title: CSS line-clamp
caniuse.description: Proprietary and undocumented CSS property that will contain text to a given amount of lines when used in combination with `display: -webkit-box`. It will end with ellipsis when `text-overflow: ellipsis` is included.

caniuse.title: @font-face Web fonts
caniuse.description: Method of displaying fonts downloaded from websites

caniuse.title: CSS3 Multiple backgrounds
caniuse.description: Method of using multiple images as a background

caniuse.title: CSS3 Border images
caniuse.description: Method of using images for borders

caniuse.title: CSS3 Background-image options
caniuse.description: New properties to affect background images, including background-clip, background-origin and background-size

caniuse.title: CSS Table display
caniuse.description: Method of displaying elements as tables, rows, and cells. Includes support for all `display: table-*` properties as well as `display: inline-table`

caniuse.title: CSS Generated content for pseudo-elements
caniuse.description: Method of displaying text or images before or after the given element's contents using the ::before and ::after pseudo-elements. All browsers with support also support the `attr()` notation in the `content` property.

caniuse.title: CSS position:fixed
caniuse.description: Method of keeping an element in a fixed location regardless of scroll position

caniuse.title: CSS 2.1 selectors
caniuse.description: Basic CSS selectors including: `*` (universal selector), `>` (child selector), `:first-child`, `:link`, `:visited`, `:active`, `:hover`, `:focus`, `:lang()`, `+` (adjacent sibling selector), `[attr]`, `[attr="val"]`, `[attr~="val"]`, `[attr|="bar"]`, `.foo` (class selector), `#foo` (id selector)

caniuse.title: CSS3 selectors
caniuse.description: Advanced element selection using selectors including: `[foo^="bar"]`, `[foo$="bar"]`, `[foo*="bar"]`, `:root`, `:nth-child()`, `:nth-last-child()`, `nth-of-type`, `nth-last-of-type()`, `:last-child`, `:first-of-type`, `:last-of-type`, `:only-child`, `:only-of-type`, `:empty`, `:target`, `:enabled`, `:disabled`, `:checked`, `:not()`, `~` (general sibling)

caniuse.title: CSS3 Text-shadow
caniuse.description: Method of applying one or more shadow or blur effects to text

caniuse.title: CSS3 Box-shadow
caniuse.description: Method of displaying an inner or outer shadow effect to elements

caniuse.title: CSS3 Colors
caniuse.description: Method of describing colors using Hue, Saturation and Lightness (hsl()) rather than just RGB, as well as allowing alpha-transparency with rgba() and hsla().

caniuse.title: CSS3 Box-sizing
caniuse.description: Method of specifying whether or not an element's borders and padding should be included in size units

caniuse.title: CSS3 Media Queries
caniuse.description: Method of applying styles based on media information. Includes things like page and device dimensions

caniuse.title: CSS3 Multiple column layout
caniuse.description: Method of flowing information in multiple columns

caniuse.title: CSS3 Border-radius (rounded corners)
caniuse.description: Method of making the border corners round. Covers support for the shorthand `border-radius` as well as the long-hand properties (e.g. `border-top-left-radius`)

caniuse.title: CSS3 2D Transforms
caniuse.description: Method of transforming an element including rotating, scaling, etc. Includes support for `transform` as well as `transform-origin` properties.

caniuse.title: Window.devicePixelRatio
caniuse.description: Read-only property that returns the ratio of the (vertical) size of one physical pixel on the current display device to the size of one CSS pixel.

caniuse.title: CSS3 3D Transforms
caniuse.description: Method of transforming an element in the third dimension using the `transform` property. Includes support for the `perspective` property to set the perspective in z-space and the `backface-visibility` property to toggle display of the reverse side of a 3D-transformed element.

caniuse.title: CSS Hyphenation
caniuse.description: Method of controlling when words at the end of lines should be hyphenated using the "hyphens" property.

caniuse.title: CSS3 Transitions
caniuse.description: Simple method of animating certain properties of an element, with ability to define property, duration, delay and timing function.

caniuse.title: CSS font-feature-settings
caniuse.description: Method of applying advanced typographic and language-specific font features to supported OpenType fonts.

caniuse.title: CSS Animation
caniuse.description: Complex method of animating certain properties of an element

caniuse.title: CSS Gradients
caniuse.description: Method of defining a linear or radial color gradient as a CSS image.

caniuse.title: CSS Canvas Drawings
caniuse.description: Method of using HTML5 Canvas as a background image. Not currently part of any specification.

caniuse.title: CSS Reflections
caniuse.description: Method of displaying a reflection of an element

caniuse.title: CSS Masks
caniuse.description: Method of displaying part of an element, using a selected image as a mask

caniuse.title: SVG in CSS backgrounds
caniuse.description: Method of using SVG images as CSS backgrounds

caniuse.title: CSS Feature Queries
caniuse.description: CSS Feature Queries allow authors to condition rules based on whether particular property declarations are supported in CSS using the @supports at rule.

caniuse.title: Flexible Box Layout Module
caniuse.description: Method of positioning elements in horizontal or vertical stacks. Support includes the support for the all properties prefixed with `flex` as well as `display: flex`, `display: inline-flex`, `align-content`, `align-items`, `align-self`, `justify-content` and `order`.

caniuse.title: CSS Backdrop Filter
caniuse.description: Method of applying filter effects (like blur, grayscale or hue) to content/elements below the target element.

caniuse.title: calc() as CSS unit value
caniuse.description: Method of allowing calculated values for length units, i.e. `width: calc(100% - 3em)`

caniuse.title: CSS3 Opacity
caniuse.description: Method of setting the transparency level of an element

caniuse.title: CSS3 Text-overflow
caniuse.description: Append ellipsis when text overflows its containing element

caniuse.title: CSS3 Overflow-wrap
caniuse.description: Allows lines to be broken within words if an otherwise unbreakable string is too long to fit. Currently mostly supported using the `word-wrap` property.

caniuse.title: CSS3 object-fit/object-position
caniuse.description: Method of specifying how an object (image or video) should fit inside its box. object-fit options include "contain" (fit according to aspect ratio), "fill" (stretches object to fill) and "cover" (overflows box but maintains ratio), where object-position allows the object to be repositioned like background-image does.

caniuse.title: CSS min/max-width/height
caniuse.description: Method of setting a minimum or maximum width or height to an element.

caniuse.title: CSS text-stroke
caniuse.description: Method of declaring the outline (stroke) width and color for text.

caniuse.title: CSS inline-block
caniuse.description: Method of displaying an element as a block while flowing it with text.

caniuse.title: CSS Grid Layout
caniuse.description: Method of using a grid concept to lay out content, providing a mechanism for authors to divide available space for lay out into columns and rows using a set of predictable sizing behaviors

caniuse.title: CSS zoom
caniuse.description: Non-standard method of scaling content.

caniuse.title: rem (root em) units
caniuse.description: Type of unit similar to `em`, but relative only to the root element, not any parent element. Thus compounding does not occur as it does with `em` units.

caniuse.title: TTF/OTF - TrueType and OpenType font support
caniuse.description: Support for the TrueType (.ttf) and OpenType (.otf) outline font formats in @font-face.

caniuse.title: CSS pointer-events (for HTML)
caniuse.description: This CSS property, when set to "none" allows elements to not receive hover/click events, instead the event will occur on anything behind it.

caniuse.title: CSS Regions
caniuse.description: Method of flowing content into multiple elements.

caniuse.title: CSS Exclusions Level 1
caniuse.description: Exclusions defines how inline content flows around elements. It extends the content wrapping ability of floats to any block-level element.

caniuse.title: CSS Counters
caniuse.description: Method of controlling number values in generated content, using the `counter-reset` and `counter-increment` properties.

caniuse.title: CSS resize property
caniuse.description: Method of allowing an element to be resized by the user, with options to limit to a given direction.

caniuse.title: CSS Repeating Gradients
caniuse.description: Method of defining a repeating linear or radial color gradient as a CSS image.

caniuse.title: CSS Filter Effects
caniuse.description: Method of applying filter effects (like blur, grayscale, brightness, contrast and hue) to elements, previously only possible by using SVG.

caniuse.title: getComputedStyle
caniuse.description: API to get the current computed CSS styles applied to an element. This may be the current value applied by an animation or as set by a stylesheet.

caniuse.title: CSS3 word-break
caniuse.description: Property to prevent or allow words to be broken over multiple lines between letters.

caniuse.title: Viewport units: vw, vh, vmin, vmax
caniuse.description: Length units representing 1% of the viewport size for viewport width (vw), height (vh), the smaller of the two (vmin), or the larger of the two (vmax).

caniuse.title: Scoped CSS
caniuse.description: Allows CSS rules to be scoped to part of the document, based on the position of the style element. The attribute has been [removed from the current specification](https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/552).

caniuse.title: CSS outline
caniuse.description: The CSS outline property is a shorthand property for setting one or more of the individual outline properties outline-style, outline-width and outline-color in a single rule. In most cases the use of this shortcut is preferable and more convenient.

caniuse.title: CSS user-select: none
caniuse.description: Method of preventing text/element selection using CSS.

caniuse.title: Intrinsic & Extrinsic Sizing
caniuse.description: Allows for the heights and widths to be specified in intrinsic values using the `fill`, `max-content`, `min-content`, and `fit-content` properties.

caniuse.title: CSS3 tab-size
caniuse.description: Method of customizing the width of the tab character. Only effective using 'white-space: pre' or 'white-space: pre-wrap'.

caniuse.title: ::selection CSS pseudo-element
caniuse.description: The ::selection CSS pseudo-element applies rules to the portion of a document that has been highlighted (e.g., selected with the mouse or another pointing device) by the user.

caniuse.title: ::placeholder CSS pseudo-element
caniuse.description: The ::placeholder pseudo-element represents placeholder text in an input field: text that represents the input and provides a hint to the user on how to fill out the form. For example, a date-input field might have the placeholder text `YYYY/MM/DD` to clarify that numeric dates are to be entered in year-month-day order.

caniuse.title: CSS Device Adaptation
caniuse.description: A standard way to override the size of viewport in web page using the `@viewport` rule, standardizing and replacing Apple's own popular `<meta>` viewport implementation.

caniuse.title: text-emphasis styling
caniuse.description: Method of using small symbols next to each glyph to emphasize a run of text, commonly used in East Asian languages. The `text-emphasis` shorthand, and its `text-emphasis-style` and `text-emphasis-color` longhands, can be used to apply marks to the text. The `text-emphasis-position` property, which inherits separately, allows setting the emphasis marks' position with respect to the text.

caniuse.title: CSS3 Cursors (original values)
caniuse.description: CSS3 cursor values added in the 2004 spec, including none, context-menu, cell, vertical-text, alias, copy, no-drop, not-allowed, nesw-resize, nwse-resize, col-resize, row-resize and all-scroll.

caniuse.title: CSS3 Cursors: zoom-in & zoom-out
caniuse.description: Support for `zoom-in`, `zoom-out` values for the CSS3 `cursor` property.

caniuse.title: CSS position:sticky
caniuse.description: Keeps elements positioned as "fixed" or "relative" depending on how it appears in the viewport. As a result the element is "stuck" when necessary while scrolling.

caniuse.title: CSS Variables (Custom Properties)
caniuse.description: Permits the declaration and usage of cascading variables in stylesheets.

caniuse.title: CSS background-blend-mode
caniuse.description: Allows blending between CSS background images, gradients, and colors.

caniuse.title: Blending of HTML/SVG elements
caniuse.description: Allows blending between arbitrary SVG and HTML elements

caniuse.title: text-decoration styling
caniuse.description: Method of defining the type, style and color of lines in the text-decoration property. These can be defined as shorthand (e.g. `text-decoration: line-through dashed blue`) or as single properties (e.g. `text-decoration-color: blue`)

caniuse.title: CSS will-change property
caniuse.description: Method of optimizing animations by informing the browser which elements will change and what properties will change.

caniuse.title: CSS Shapes Level 1
caniuse.description: Allows geometric shapes to be set in CSS to define an area for text to flow around.

caniuse.title: Improved kerning pairs & ligatures
caniuse.description: Currently non-standard method of improving kerning pairs & ligatures using `text-rendering: optimizeLegibility`.

caniuse.title: CSS3 image-orientation
caniuse.description: CSS property used generally to fix the intended orientation of an image. This can be done using 90 degree increments or based on the image's EXIF data using the "from-image" value.

caniuse.title: CSS text-size-adjust
caniuse.description: On mobile devices, the text-size-adjust CSS property allows Web authors to control if and how the text-inflating algorithm is applied to the textual content of the element it is applied to.

caniuse.title: CSS Appearance
caniuse.description: The `appearance` property defines how elements (particularly form controls) appear by default. By setting the value to `none` the default appearance can be entirely redefined using other CSS properties.

caniuse.title: CSS background-position edge offsets
caniuse.description: Allows CSS background images to be positioned relative to the specified edge using the 3 to 4 value syntax. For example: `background-position: right 5px bottom 5px;` for positioning 5px from the bottom-right corner.

caniuse.title: CSS touch-action property
caniuse.description: touch-action is a CSS property that controls filtering of gesture events, providing developers with a declarative mechanism to selectively disable touch scrolling (in one or both axes), pinch-zooming or double-tap-zooming.

caniuse.title: CSS clip-path property
caniuse.description: Method of defining the visible region of an element using SVG or a shape definition.

caniuse.title: CSS Font Loading
caniuse.description: This CSS module defines a scripting interface to font faces in CSS, allowing font faces to be easily created and loaded from script. It also provides methods to track the loading status of an individual font, or of all the fonts on an entire page.

caniuse.title: Font unicode-range subsetting
caniuse.description: This @font-face descriptor defines the set of Unicode codepoints that may be supported by the font face for which it is declared. The descriptor value is a comma-delimited list of Unicode range (<urange>) values. The union of these ranges defines the set of codepoints that serves as a hint for user agents when deciding whether or not to download a font resource for a given text run.

caniuse.title: CSS font-stretch
caniuse.description: If a font has multiple types of variations based on the width of characters, the `font-stretch` property allows the appropriate one to be selected. The property in itself does not cause the browser to stretch to a font.

caniuse.title: CSS font-size-adjust
caniuse.description: Method of adjusting the font size in a matter that relates to the height of lowercase vs. uppercase letters. This makes it easier to set the size of fallback fonts.

caniuse.title: Media Queries: resolution feature
caniuse.description: Allows a media query to be set based on the device pixels used per CSS unit. While the standard uses `min`/`max-resolution` for this, some browsers support the older non-standard `device-pixel-ratio` media query.

caniuse.title: CSS image-set
caniuse.description: Method of letting the browser pick the most appropriate CSS background image from a given set, primarily for high PPI screens.

caniuse.title: CSS box-decoration-break
caniuse.description: Controls whether the box's margins, borders, padding, and other decorations wrap the broken edges of the box fragments (when the box is split by a break (page/column/region/line).

caniuse.title: CSS Counter Styles
caniuse.description: The @counter-style CSS at-rule allows custom counter styles to be defined. A @counter-style rule defines how to convert a counter value into a string representation.

caniuse.title: CSS page-break properties
caniuse.description: Properties to control the way elements are broken across (printed) pages.

caniuse.title: :placeholder-shown CSS pseudo-class
caniuse.description: Input elements can sometimes show placeholder text as a hint to the user on what to type in. See, for example, the placeholder attribute in HTML5. The :placeholder-shown pseudo-class matches an input element that is showing such placeholder text.

caniuse.title: Crisp edges/pixelated images
caniuse.description: Scales images with an algorithm that preserves edges and contrast, without smoothing colors or introducing blur. This is intended for images such as pixel art. Official values that accomplish this for the `image-rendering` property are `crisp-edges` and `pixelated`.

caniuse.title: CSS3 text-align-last
caniuse.description: CSS property to describe how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break when `text-align` is `justify`.

caniuse.title: CSS Logical Properties
caniuse.description: Use start/end properties that depend on LTR or RTL writing direction instead of left/right

caniuse.title: CSS background-attachment
caniuse.description: Method of defining how a background image is attached to a scrollable element. Values include `scroll` (default), `fixed` and `local`.

caniuse.title: CSS currentColor value
caniuse.description: A CSS value that will apply the existing `color` value to other properties like `background-color`, etc.

caniuse.title: CSS Scroll snap points
caniuse.description: CSS technique that allows customizable scrolling experiences like pagination of carousels by setting defined snap points.

caniuse.title: Media Queries: interaction media features
caniuse.description: Allows a media query to be set based on the presence and accuracy of the user's pointing device, and whether they have the ability to hover over elements on the page. This includes the `pointer`, `any-pointer`, `hover`, and `any-hover` media features.

caniuse.title: CSS font-smooth
caniuse.description: Controls the application of anti-aliasing when fonts are rendered.

caniuse.title: CSS3 font-kerning
caniuse.description: Controls the usage of the kerning information (spacing between letters) stored in the font. Note that this only affects OpenType fonts with kerning information, it has no effect on other fonts.

caniuse.title: CSS font-variant-alternates
caniuse.description: Controls the usage of alternate glyphs associated to alternative names defined in @font-feature-values for certain types of OpenType fonts.

caniuse.title: CSS filter() function
caniuse.description: This function filters a CSS input image with a set of filter functions (like blur, grayscale or hue)

caniuse.title: CSS element() function
caniuse.description: This function renders a live image generated from an arbitrary HTML element

caniuse.title: ::first-letter CSS pseudo-element selector
caniuse.description: CSS pseudo-element that allows styling only the first "letter" of text within an element. Useful for implementing initial caps or drop caps styling.

caniuse.title: CSS all property
caniuse.description: A shorthand property for resetting all CSS properties except for `direction` and `unicode-bidi`.

caniuse.title: CSS initial value
caniuse.description: A CSS value that will apply a property's initial value as defined in the CSS specification that defines the property

caniuse.title: letter-spacing CSS property
caniuse.description: Controls spacing between characters of text (i.e. "tracking" in typographical terms). Not to be confused with kerning.

caniuse.title: CSS unset value
caniuse.description: A CSS value that's the same as "inherit" if a property is inherited or "initial" if a property is not inherited.

caniuse.title: CSS Cross-Fade Function
caniuse.description: Image function to create a "crossfade" between images. This allows one image to transition (fade) into another based on a percentage value.

caniuse.title: CSS writing-mode property
caniuse.description: Property to define whether lines of text are laid out horizontally or vertically and the direction in which blocks progress.

caniuse.title: CSS Motion Path
caniuse.description: Allows elements to be animated along SVG paths or shapes

caniuse.title: CSSOM Scroll-behavior
caniuse.description: Method of specifying the scrolling behavior for a scrolling box, when scrolling happens due to navigation or CSSOM scrolling APIs.

caniuse.title: :in-range and :out-of-range CSS pseudo-classes
caniuse.description: If a temporal or number `<input>` has `max` and/or `min` attributes, then `:in-range` matches when the value is within the specified range and `:out-of-range` matches when the value is outside the specified range. If there are no range constraints, then neither pseudo-class matches.

caniuse.title: background-position-x & background-position-y
caniuse.description: CSS longhand properties to define x or y positions separately.

caniuse.title: CSS revert value
caniuse.description: A CSS keyword value that resets a property's value to the default specified by the browser in its UA stylesheet, as if the webpage had not included any CSS. For example, `display:revert` on a `<div>` would result in `display:block`. This is in contrast to the `initial` value, which is simply defined on a per-property basis, and for `display` would be `inline`.

caniuse.title: CSS widows & orphans
caniuse.description: CSS properties to control when lines break across pages or columns by defining the amount of lines that must be left before or after the break.

caniuse.title: selector list argument of :nth-child and :nth-last-child CSS pseudo-classes
caniuse.description: The newest versions of `:nth-child()` and `:nth-last-child()` accept an optional `of S` clause which filters the children to only those which match the selector list `S`. For example, `:nth-child(1 of .foo)` selects the first child among the children that have the `foo` class (ignoring any non-`foo` children which precede that child). Similar to `:nth-of-type`, but for arbitrary selectors instead of only type selectors.

caniuse.title: :matches() CSS pseudo-class
caniuse.description: The `:matches()` (formerly `:any()`) pseudo-class checks whether the element at its position in the outer selector matches any of the selectors in its selector list. It's useful syntactic sugar that allows you to avoid writing out all the combinations manually as separate selectors. The effect is similar to nesting in Sass and most other CSS preprocessors.

caniuse.title: CSS text-justify
caniuse.description: CSS property to define how text should be justified when `text-align: justify` is set.

caniuse.title: CSS scrollbar styling
caniuse.description: Non-standard methods of styling scrollbars.

caniuse.title: Case-insensitive CSS attribute selectors
caniuse.description: Including an `i` before the `]` in a CSS attribute selector causes the attribute value to be matched in an ASCII-case-insensitive manner. For example, `[b="xyz" i]` would match both `<a b="xyz">` and `<a b="XYZ">`.

caniuse.title: :default CSS pseudo-class
caniuse.description: The `:default` pseudo-class matches checkboxes and radio buttons which are checked by default, `<option>`s with the `selected` attribute, and the default submit button (if any) of a form.

caniuse.title: :optional CSS pseudo-class
caniuse.description: The `:optional` pseudo-class matches form inputs (`<input>`, `<textarea>`, `<select>`) which are not `:required`.

caniuse.title: :indeterminate CSS pseudo-class
caniuse.description: The `:indeterminate` pseudo-class matches indeterminate checkboxes, indeterminate `<progress>` bars, and radio buttons with no checked button in their radio button group.

caniuse.title: Explicit descendant combinator >>
caniuse.description: An explicit, non-whitespace spelling of the descendant combinator. `A >> B` is equivalent to `A B`.

caniuse.title: :has() CSS relational pseudo-class
caniuse.description: Only select elements containing specified content. For example, `a:has(>img)` selects all `` elements that contain an `` child.

caniuse.title: selector list argument of :not()
caniuse.description: Selectors Level 4 allows the `:not()` pseudo-class to accept a list of selectors, which the element must not match any of. Selectors Level 3 only allowed `:not()` to accept a single simple selector. Thus, `:not(a):not(.b):not([c])` can instead be written as `:not(a, .b, [c])`

caniuse.title: :dir() CSS pseudo-class
caniuse.description: Matches elements based on their directionality. `:dir(ltr)` matches elements which are Left-to-Right. `:dir(rtl)` matches elements which are Right-to-Left.

caniuse.title: :focus-within CSS pseudo-class
caniuse.description: The `:focus-within` pseudo-class matches elements that either themselves match `:focus` or that have descendants which match `:focus`.

caniuse.title: CSS3 attr() function
caniuse.description: CSS Values and Units Level 3 adds the ability to use `attr()` on any CSS property, not just `content`, and to use it for non-string values (e.g. numbers, colors).

caniuse.title: CSS Containment
caniuse.description: The CSS `contain` property lets developers limit the scope of the browser's styles, layout and paint work for faster and more efficient rendering.

caniuse.title: ch (character) unit
caniuse.description: Unit representing the width of the character "0" in the current font, of particular use in combination with monospace fonts.
